title: Honey Teriyaki Swordfish Steaks
summary: The recipe Honey Teriyaki Swordfish Steaks could satisfy your Japanese craving in around 3 hours and 15 minutes. This recipe serves 1 and costs $16.5 per serving. Watching your figure? This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe has 1384 calories, 143g of protein, and 73g of fat per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Only a few people really liked this main course. If you have teriyaki sauce, center cut swordfish steaks, garlic cloves, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is perfect for valentin day. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 70%, which is good. Similar recipes include Honey Teriyaki Swordfish Steaks, Honey-mustard Swordfish Steaks, and Teriyaki Swordfish Kabobs.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 99 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: In a medium saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat.Add onion, garlic and ginger, saute about 3 minutes.Add teriyaki sauce and honey; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.Simmer about 2 minutes.Allow to cool to room temperature.In a small dish reserve 1/4 cup sauce for basting, cover and place in fridge.Put the fish steaks in a large resealable plastic bag and pour remaining sauce over them.Put the fish in fridge and marinate 2 to 3 hours.Preheat the grill for 5 minutes.Spray both sides of grill with non-stick cooking spray.Grill fish steaks for 4 minutes or until almost half done.Open grill and remove steaks; wipe grill clean and spray both sides again with non-stick cooking spray.Return the steaks to the grill and baste with the reserved 1/4 cup sauce.Grill 3 more minutes.

steps.step: In a medium saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic and ginger, saute about 3 minutes.

Add teriyaki sauce and honey; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.Simmer about 2 minutes.Allow to cool to room temperature.In a small dish reserve 1/4 cup sauce for basting, cover and place in fridge.
Put the fish steaks in a large resealable plastic bag and pour remaining sauce over them.

Put the fish in fridge and marinate 2 to 3 hours.Preheat the grill for 5 minutes.Spray both sides of grill with non-stick cooking spray.Grill fish steaks for 4 minutes or until almost half done.Open grill and remove steaks; wipe grill clean and spray both sides again with non-stick cooking spray.Return the steaks to the grill and baste with the reserved 1/4 cup sauce.Grill 3 more minutes.
